content.description: Walk up ramp to short vertical wall. Work up on crimps and jugs to a good ledge at bolted anchors. Good beginner lead
content.location: On large wall left of wall greens. Left most bolted line.

content.description: Pretty simple face climb with small feet for the start. There is the possibility for a few variations but none of them make the climb harder than V3ish
content.protection: 1 pad is good enough. 2 if you wanna try some variations
content.location: It is a north facing wall on the way to the bamboo forest. It is just up the trail from right field and tomb stone.

content.description: Same start as Vertical Vector but stay on right face. Go up on small ledges and crimps to sloppy top out.
content.location: Far left face of diagonal boulder.

content.description: Start with left hand on arete pinch and right on slopey pinch. Go up and around arete to top out on slab on left face.
content.location: On far left of diagonal boulder which is up the hill right before the bamboo forest

content.description: Climb up super easy slab to an awkward mantle top.
content.location: Just left of tombstone.

content.description: There's plenty of good trees for anchoring and a couple of nice little finger/hand cracks. I rated it 5.7, but with the cracks, it might be closer to 5.8, but generally it's not difficult. Not too many cracks to work in this area so it's a fun little spot.
content.protection: Top rope is the most practical way to go, but you could lead it with some cams. There are no bolts or hangers.
content.location: Just passed the EP17 trail marker, immediately before you enter the bamboo forest, upriver from the Overlook Deck, turn right onto a subtle trail. Look for the formation uphill right off the trail, easier to see in the winter. Little bit of scrambling will get you to the formation, easily identifiable by the teetering stack of blocks looming over you as you approach. Scramble and claw your way around the left of the formation to get on top of it for top-rope access.

content.description: Climb up easy ledges and jugs to top by the tombstone.
content.location: Just before bamboo forest. Seen from the trail.

content.description: Start low on crimp rail with bad feet. Go up on progressively easier ledges to a sketchy top out.
content.location: On your right when heading upstream. Downriver of bamboo forest and upriver of tombstone.

content.description: Climb up slab with crimps to a mantle top.
content.location: Above tombstone.

content.description: Same start as Rite Aid, traverse left until 2bd crack by the oak tree and arete. Top out straight up on flat ledges and a secret dimple.
content.location: Halfway between bamboo forest and tombstone areas. On right if going upstream.

content.description: Sit start underneath the finish to sexbruise with hands matched on a shelf. Work out from under the roof and top out the same as sexbruise.
content.location: Halfway between bamboo forest and tombstone areas. On right if going upstream.

content.description: Start far right ledge rails move left until first vertical crack go straight up to classic Southern Sloppy Top.
content.location: On the right between bamboo Forrest and tombstone area.

content.description: Climb up and right under large mitten style obtrusion.
content.location: Left and back from tombstone.

content.description: If you like placing micronuts in chossy cracks on slab then this is the climb for you. Start at bottom right of green face and go up and trend left on a finger tip crack and crimps. Top out on a flat ledge under the large detached flake into some briers.
content.protection: BD nuts and one #4 cam for the top
content.location: On the left face of Teeter Totem, up the hill directly before the start of the bamboo forest.

content.description: Start on lowest ledges below roof with a heel hook. Go up ledges to get high feet below the roof. Do a big move to the hueco. Top out up and slightly right of the mouth.
content.location: Up the hill from right before the bamboo forest

content.description: Climb up arete to the left of the large mouth shape pocket. Start on ledges below roof, then throw for sidepull around arete. Compress the sidepull and hueco for the move to the top.
content.location: Directly left of teeter totem. Up the hill just before the bamboo forest

content.description: Start on sidepull pocket and flat rail. Hand foot match for a big move to a dirty pocket. Top out with meat hooks and slopers.
content.location: Just left of the tree growing in front of diagonal boulder

content.description: Climb up proud but easy arete to a large flat ledge. Walk off right.
content.location: Just right of teeter totem

content.description: Start with left hand in 3 finger pocket and right hand on crimp at chin level. Stand on shallow ridges to better crimps to classic southern sloppy top.
content.location: Middle face of diagonal boulder.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the rail below where you would start sexbruise/rite aid. Use a series of heel hooks and toe cams to traverse right. Stay under the roof keeping hands low until you reach the far left of the boulder. Finish by going up the boulder at the far left following the sexbruise topout. Easier if you don't use a pad for the traverse because your back will scrape on the pad.
content.location: Halfway between bamboo forest and tombstone areas. On right if going upstream.

content.description: Start on left facing flake below roof. Move up to top of flake before reaching for the small holds at the lip. Rock over a foot to top out correctly or use the tree if you start falling.
content.location: Downriver of bamboo forest but upriver of tombstone

content.description: Start on ramp and work up on crimps and sloped ledges to easy top to anchors.2 bolts and bolted anchors. Watch out for tree that fell at base of route.
content.location: Large wall left of wall greens. Right most bolted route

content.description:
Between Ep 26 and 16. There is a great potential for new lines here if the vegetation would cooperate.

 Heading north/up river from ep.16, tombstone area is first, wallgreens is second, and teeter tottem is third(directly before the bamboo forest)
